summary: In the U.S., about 1 in 10 young adults and 1 in 30 minors under age 18 experience homelessness without a parent or caregiver over the course of a year. Homelessness is higher among some groups, such as youth of color and transgender youth. Although the Departments of Housing and Urban Development and Health and Human Services provide grants to local organizations to operate programs...
title: Youth Homelessness: HUD and HHS Could Enhance Coordination to Better Support Communities
